title: [Large-scale] Laboratory-Based Instructional Design Course for Secondary School Teachers' Computer Science Retraining

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and pedagogical understanding
context.additional_context: Weekly 3-hour intensive practical sessions + online collaborative task completion

learning_goals: Development of instructional design capabilities utilizing core computer science concepts (algorithms, programming, data structures) in laboratory environments

Learners analyze 3 secondary education cases, derive instructional design principles applying ≥ 3 critical thinking strategies (e.g., Socratic Questioning, Cost-Benefit Analysis), and write a 1,500-character field applicability report within 3 weeks meeting ≥ 4 of 5 evaluation checklist items.

Learners complete 1 lesson design plan in a blended learning environment (online discussions + in-person classes) over 4 weeks, incorporating ≥ 3 peer feedback sessions and ≥ 2 instructor coaching sessions. They achieve ≥ 4 points (5-point scale) in ≥ 4 of 5 peer evaluation rubric items.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
